remarks: Lemma for ~ seqf1o .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2016.)
statement:
seqf1o.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. S ) $.
seqf1o.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. C /\ y e. C ) ) -> ( x .+ y ) = ( y .+ x ) ) $.
seqf1o.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S /\ z e. S ) ) -> ( ( x .+ y ) .+ z ) = ( x .+ ( y .+ z ) ) ) $.
seqf1o.4 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
seqf1o.5 $e |- ( ph -> C C_ S ) $.
seqf1olem2a.1 $e |- ( ph -> G : A --> C ) $.
seqf1olem2a.3 $e |- ( ph -> K e. A ) $.
seqf1olem2a.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( M ... N ) C_ A ) $.
seqf1olem2a $p |- ( ph -> ( ( G ` K ) .+ ( seq M ( .+ , G ) ` N ) ) = ( ( seq M ( .+ , G ) ` N ) .+ ( G ` K ) ) ) $.
$d .+ x y z $.
$d C x y z $.
$d G x y z $.
$d K x y z $.
$d M x y z $.
$d N x y z $.
$d S x y z $.
$d ph x y z $.
